lead: Exploring the latest developments in health, from exercise benefits to the impact of AI on medical information.

stories.title: Does Walking Count as Exercise? Fitness Experts Weigh In
stories.summary: Walking is often underestimated as a form of exercise, yet fitness experts affirm its numerous health benefits. Regular walking can improve cardiovascular health, aid in weight management, and enhance mental well-being. This article discusses how even moderate walking can contribute significantly to overall fitness and health.

stories.title: Expert-Approved Continuous Glucose Monitors for Easy Tracking in 2026
stories.summary: Continuous glucose monitors (CGMs) are becoming essential tools for managing diabetes effectively. This article highlights expert-recommended CGMs for 2026, emphasizing their ease of use and the critical role they play in tracking glucose levels. With advancements in technology, these devices are making diabetes management more accessible and accurate.

stories.title: How Google AI Overviews is Putting Public Health at Risk
stories.summary: A recent study reveals that Google's AI Overviews often cite YouTube more than reputable medical sites for health queries, raising concerns about the reliability of information provided to users. Experts warn that this reliance on less credible sources could lead to misinformation and health risks for the public. The implications of AI in health information dissemination are significant and warrant scrutiny.

stories.title: Can ChatGPT Health Do Better Than 'Dr. Google'?
stories.summary: As more people turn to AI for medical advice, the effectiveness of platforms like ChatGPT Health is under examination. This article compares the traditional 'Dr. Google' approach with emerging AI technologies, discussing their potential to provide more accurate and personalized health information. The shift towards AI in healthcare raises questions about trust and reliability.

stories.title: My Analogue Month: Would Ditching My Smartphone Make Me Healthier?
stories.summary: A personal experiment of living without a smartphone reveals insights into the impact of technology on mental health. The author reflects on the distractions and stressors of constant connectivity, suggesting that a break from digital devices may enhance mental well-being and awareness of the surrounding world. This narrative explores the balance between technology use and health.

stories.title: The Download: Chatbots for Health and US Fights Over AI Regulation
stories.summary: This edition of The Download discusses the rise of AI chatbots in healthcare, addressing both their potential benefits and the regulatory challenges they face. As AI becomes more integrated into health services, the need for clear guidelines and ethical considerations is becoming increasingly urgent. The conversation highlights the intersection of technology and health policy.

stories.title: Wes Streeting Invites Expert to Discuss Social Media Ban for Under-16s
stories.summary: UK Health Secretary Wes Streeting is advocating for a potential ban on social media for users under 16, inspired by a similar initiative in Australia. This move aims to address mental health concerns associated with social media use among young people. The discussion reflects growing awareness of the impact of digital environments on youth health.
